User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the Hotel RIGUT application.

email.description: The email address of the user.

registrationDate.description: The date and time when the user registered.

definition.description: Stores user profile information. Accessible only by the user (userId) or an administrator (document in /roles_admin/{uid}).

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier of the user.

definition.description: Indicates administrative privileges for the user with the given UID. The presence of a document at this path grants admin rights.

params.name: uid
params.description: The unique identifier of the user with admin privileges.

firestore.reasoning:
Given the requirement for user authentication with username/PIN and the need for user management by your partners, the structure focuses on securely storing user profiles. We will use a simple collection `/users/{userId}` to store user data. This path-based ownership allows for straightforward security rules ensuring only the user or an admin can access/modify their data.

For administrative access, a separate `/roles_admin/{uid}` collection will be used to grant admin privileges. Existence of a document in `/roles_admin/{uid}` indicates admin status.

This design supports required QAPs by:

1.  Segregation: User data is isolated in their respective `/users/{userId}` documents.
2.  Path-Based Ownership: Enforces strict access control.
